text: Love the Gillette ad. The people it offended are the people that needed to hear it the most

I find it encouraging that companies can spread such a message and not be worried about completely destroying their bottom line (much like Nike). I think it's a good sign for society. The ad made me ugly cry. But then again I also know that the ad was meant to draw an emotion out of me. So I feel like it was pandering quite a bit to feminists like myself? I wonder how many women buy razors for their partners, and if Gillette is trying to gain favor among those decision-making women. All press about the ad is good press for the brand.
I loved it & honestly if you were “offended” - you’re one of those d*ckheads... 😆

So surprised that people are angry about it!! It is very simple, not over the top and tasteful. Basically just about being a good human, I think anyone who is mad is probably part of the problem. I loved it!
I liked it... I also agreed with Melanie Murphy ' s response video
Update: Stephen Colbert made commentary on this on his latest talkshow ep (right before Jake Gyllenhaal was interviewed). They made a mock, response ad just fyi.

I’m a bit indifferent as well. I like the story they’re trying to tell with the commercial, but it’s really focused towards women. And the majority of people doing groceries (and thus buying Gillette, because now they have a “positive” feeling towards this brand) are women. Do they really want to “make a change” or is it just a marketing strategy? Really looking forward to this podcast 👏

Today I watched the episode where Ellen degeneres came out and they had to cancel her show and I was 3 years old when that happened but things are a lot better now! got me thinking about how slow things are to change but all it takes is a few of the coolest people to be brave and break the pattern.  I have been really disappointed with men lately because I have been trying to get back into dating but guys seem even worse than before my last relationship. Guys are almost encouraged to be jerks and act like you're the crazy one if you want to be respected. Or prudish if you want to be monogamous. Im Going back to single 5ever and then maybe in 20 years things will be better thanks to this Gillette ad and I can have an old man bf in my golden years

Loved the ad however I wonder if Gillette will take any other steps besides this. Gillette also makes “women’s razors” which are often more expensive and taxed more  than men’s razors in the US  for reasons I’m unsure of.

I find the negativity surrounding this to be the most interesting part, as I did not see this as an ad bashing men.  I think most men are pretty decent, as are most women.  But by standing by and doing nothing, even those of us who would never engage in sexist or catty acts ourselves somehow imply that such hurtful acts are at least tolerable, if not acceptable.  I doubt that this Gillette ad will help the company's bottom line, but if it encourages more good guys to speak out against behaviors they personally don't engage in, then all of us will benefit.  Now I'm waiting for an ad from a woman's company encouraging women to speak out against malicious gossip and "mean girl" bullying!

I was shocked at all the dislikes and really agressive negative comments. To me it just shows how much this is needed ! I love the add ! But another question is about the appropriation of a "mouvement" by a brand, and actually on argument saying that the "bad guys" were all white men and those acting right allmost only of colour.. There is a point.

Tbh yes it’s about profit and advertising their product but if they can also promote a better life at the same time the surely this is only a good thing! Maybe it shows that we are moving towards a better world?

Adds are for profit. We all know that but if brands use it to spread  good things, better. I don't understand all the hate.  I didn't with the last Nike add, either. Looking forward the podcast. As always! (And for moving news)💛

Yay new podcast!! As for the ad, tbh I’m indifferent because I work in the industry that makes ads like this. Bottom line is it’s all about business and money. It’s whatever ideas/agendas can get more sales is the objective, and the need to be ‘forward thinking’. Look at the whole range of P&G owned companies and decide if this message is widespread. Are they respectful to women in all ads and treat them with intelligence, are their ads diverse with a variety of people? How deep is this philosophy or did they just make an ad to garner some favor over their competitors and new startups? Take it with a grain of salt. 🧂
@jennymustard don’t say it now, save it for the podcast! 😘
Yesssss vill se mer sånt i världen!!
